description:
Join us for an unforgettable evening of music in support of Manitoba Opera’s Digital Emerging Artists Program.

Nestled in the Lake of the Woods, the intimate setting of Dr. Mark & Theresa Barker’s lakeside cottage provides the perfect backdrop for this extraordinary event, allowing you to immerse yourself in the beauty of both the music and the natural environment.
htmlDescription:
We look forward to having you join us for an unforgettable evening of music in support of Manitoba Opera’s Digital Emerging Artists Program.


Nestled in the Lake of the Woods, the intimate setting of Dr. Mark & Theresa Barker’s lakeside cottage provides the perfect backdrop for this extraordinary event, allowing you to immerse yourself in the beauty of both the music and the natural environment.

This unique event will feature captivating performances by Dr. Minna Chung, Tracy Dahl, Gwen Hoebig, Monica Huisman, Dr. Laura Loewen, Dr. David Moroz, and John Tessier.

Read The Artist Bios

Tickets will be available until Wednesday, August 13.
After that date call our box office at 204-944-8824 for assistance.
name: 2025 Lake of the Woods Concert

locations.name: Fire Road 2, McCallum Point Road, Clearwater Bay

description: Experience “the definitive portrait” of Maria Callas, capturing the legendary soprano whose 1953 Tosca performance set the modern standard.
htmlDescription:
Award-winning British film maker Tony Palmer’s documentary has been called “the definitive portrait" (Daily Express) of legendary soprano Maria Callas. This is a deeply moving film about the diva whose 1953 portrayal of Tosca became the gold standard for modern interpreters of the role.

Run time: 92 minutes

Saturday, October 18 at 12:00 PM
Doors open at 11:30 AM
Dave Barber Cinematheque, 100 Arthur Street

Theatre concessions will be open.
name: Film Screening: Callas

description: Join us for a screening of Maria, the acclaimed 2024 drama starring Angelina Jolie as Maria Callas in her final days.
htmlDescription:
Maria is a 2024 biographical psychological drama film starring Angelina Jolie as opera singer Maria Callas, following the singer in the week before her death in 1977 Paris as she reflects on her life and career. The film earned a nomination for Best Cinematography at the 97th Academy Awards, and Jolie was nominated for Best Actress in a Motion Picture - Drama at the 82nd Golden Globe Awards.

Introduction by Alison Gillmor, Free Press Arts & Life Columnist

Run time: 124 minutes
English

Friday, October 24, 1:00 PM
Landmark Cinemas, Grant Park Mall
name: Film Screening: Maria

description: Step behind the curtain to explore Tosca’s rare hand-painted “soft scenery” set and experience its artistry up close.
htmlDescription:
Discover the fascinating history behind the Tosca set which is THE LAST example of a “soft scenery” set in use since its creation in Italy in the 1950s, learn about the art of creating soft scenery, and have an opportunity to go on stage to see the set up close. The extraordinary artistry on display in Tosca’s hand-painted sets uses trompe l’oeil to create convincing illusions and would be prohibitively expensive to produce today.

Presented by Andrew Beck, Set Backdrops & Soft Goods Painter

Tuesday, November 18 at 5 PM
Doors open at 4:30 PM
Lobby and stage, Centennial Concert Hall

Registration is free, capacity is limited.
name: Lecture & Set Tour: The Art of Soft Scenery

description: A one-hour presentation that introduces the characters and synopsis of the opera.
htmlDescription:
A one-hour presentation that introduces the characters and synopsis of the opera, with video examples.

Presented by Dr. Scott Miller.

Saturday, November 15, 1:00 PM
Doors open at 12:30 PM
Canadian Museum for Human Rights classroom.
name: Opera Primer: Tosca

description: Enjoy an evening of painting, wine, and live opera with artist Goldie Yudelevich and soprano Karen Santos.
htmlDescription:
Join us for a fun and light-hearted evening of art, song, and wine! Participants will paint a take-home wine glass in a workshop led by artist Goldie Yudelevich, enjoy a specialty mocktail and sample Italian wines provided by Escalade Wines, and hear a selection of opera arias performed by soprano Karen Santos.

Tickets: $50/person including GST (Capacity: 50)

Tuesday, October 21 at 7 pm
Doors open at 6:30 pm
First Unitarian Universalist Church of Winnipeg, 603 Wellington Cres.

No experience necessary. All supplies provided.
name: Paint Night

locations.name: First Unitarian Universalist Church of Winnipeg TM ID: 58

description: A 90-minute panel on Tosca and the clash between personal freedom and authoritarian power.
htmlDescription:
Puccini's opera Tosca is a political thriller that centers on two unfortunate lovers who become entangled in a corrupt official's deadly hunt for a political enemy. This 90-minute panel discussion focuses on the conflicts that arise when the rights of individuals are challenged by authoritarian regimes.

Panelists TBA

Sunday, October 26, 1:00 PM
Doors open at 12:30 PM
Canadian Museum for Human Rights Classroom.
name: Panel Discussion: Speaking Rights to Power

description: It’s the eve of Figaro and Susanna’s wedding, but nothing is going right. The Count’s wandering eye has landed on the bride-to-be. Cherubino, the page, is sweet on the Countess, and Marcellina, the governess, is chasing after Figaro.
htmlDescription:
OH, WHAT A DAY!


It’s the eve of Figaro and Susanna’s wedding, but nothing is going right. The Count’s wandering eye has landed on the bride-to-be. Cherubino, the page, is sweet on the Countess, and Marcellina, the governess, is chasing after Figaro.

Mozart’s great ensemble comedy features a colourful cast of characters and a whirlwind of tricks, disguises, and mistaken identities. Can the servants turn the tables on the masters in order to teach the Count a lesson and save the wedding? Will love triumph?

From the famous overture to the finale, this social commentary on class and love unfolds with brilliant music, memorable melodies, and heart-breaking tenderness as the characters ponder young love, lost love, and forgiveness.

Sung in Italian with projected English translations.

MUSIC Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart
LIBRETTO Lorenzo da Ponte
(Based on Pierre-Augustin Beaumarchais’ comic play Le Mariage de Figaro)

Artists:

  • Count Almaviva - Phillip Addis
  • Countess Almaviva - Jamie Groote
  • Figaro - Robert Mellon
  • Susanna - Caitlin Wood
  • Conductor - Gordon Gerrard
name: The Marriage of Figaro

description: Heart-pounding drama, intense passion, and soaring melodies are a killer combination in this fateful day in the life of the diva Tosca.
htmlDescription:
Supremely Operatic!


Heart-pounding drama, intense passion, and soaring melodies are a killer combination in this fateful day in the life of the diva Tosca.

In revolutionary Rome, the fiery, famous singer lives for art and love but finds herself in a life-and-death struggle when her lover, the painter Cavaradossi, is caught trying to protect a freedom fighter. Scarpia, the corrupt chief of police will stop at nothing to satisfy his lust for her. In this game of deadly political intrigue will Tosca submit to Scarpia’s desires or see her lover die? Can Scarpia’s evil reach from beyond the grave?

This spell-binding classic features some of Puccini’s best: “Vissi d’arte,” the opera’s most famous aria in which Tosca sings that she’s always lived her life for art and love; Cavaradossi’s “Recondita armonia”; Scarpia’s “Te Deum,” sung with self-satisfied villainy and madness; and “E lucevan le stelle,” Cavaradossi’s farewell to Tosca.

Sung in Italian with projected English translations.

MUSIC Giacomo Puccini
LIBRETTO Luigi Illica and Giuseppe Giacosa
(Based on Victorien Sardou’s drama La Tosca)

Artists:

  • Tosca - Marina Costa-Jackson
  • Cavaradossi - David Pomeroy
  • Scarpia - Gregory Dahl
  • Conductor - Tyrone Paterson

(Cast is subject to change.)
name: Tosca

description: Enjoy a wine reception followed by a three-course dinner catered by Bergmann's on Lombard.
htmlDescription:
Saturday, November 22 | 5 pm

Piano Nobile, Centennial Concert Hall

$150/person (Does not include a ticket to the performance)

Enjoy a wine reception followed by a three-course dinner, catered by Bergmann’s on
Lombard.

Complimentary parking and coat check included.

MENU

Appetizer

Soft Burrata Caprese Salad with Mixed Tuscan Greens & Vine Tomatoes and Balsamic Herb Vinaigrette

Entrée

Slow Red Wine Braised Boneless Prairie Beef Short Rib with Saskatoon infused Cabernet Sauce

Seasonal Market Vegetable Speckled Risotto alla Milanese

Vegetarian Entrée
Roasted Bell Pepper Stuffed with Chickpea Hummus, Eggplant, Orzo, Black Olive & Caper Puttanesca Sauce

Dessert

Callebaut™ Chocolate Pot de Crème and Gingersnap & Seasonal Berries

Premium Roast Coffee & Tea Service | Dinner Breads & Butter
name: Tosca Opening Night Dinner

description: Explore how Puccini fused romantic lyricism with modern verismo in Tosca.
htmlDescription:
In this lecture, you’ll hear about how Puccini combined long-breathed romantic arias with modern verismo style, creating a soundscape of early 19th-century Rome in Tosca (1900).

Presented by Colette Simonot-Maiello, Associate Professor of Musicology and Associate Dean at the Desautels Faculty of Music.

Saturday, November 1, 1:00 PM
Doors open at 12:30 PM
Canadian Museum for Human Rights Classroom
name: Understanding the Music: Tosca
